Key Match Events: Alex Hales and Jos Buttler produced the largest and greatest opening partnership in Englandâ€™s Twenty20 history
Suryakumar Yadav failed to catch Jos Buttler and managed to shovel the ball 10 yards to the rope
Pre-Game Insights: England chose to chase despite the consensus that chasing more than 160 was difficult
Adelaide Oval was considered a good wicket for scoring runs
Post-Match Reflections: England's three previous run chases in the competition were uncomfortable, but this was a team transformed
Jos Buttler said Hardik Pandya showed what a good wicket it was
Miscellaneous Highlights: Adil Rashid was outstanding, going at five an over and taking the key wicket of Yadav
Chris Jordan replaced the injured Mark Wood and took three wickets in his first game of the tournament
